result.name: northern-ireland-marine-recorder-database-collated-marine-species-and-biotope-point-data
result.notes:
Species, biotope and physical point data, with accompanying information and metadata for marine surveys and data collection activities conducted within the Celtic and Irish Seas and NE Atlantic Ocean around Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland, collated and stored on the Marine Recorder database hosted and maintained by the Centre for Environmental Data and Recording (CEDaR), National Museums Northern Ireland. 
     The Marine Recorder database holds approx. 500,000 species occurrence records from a range of data providers: DAERA Marine and Fisheries Division, Agri-Food and Biosciences Institute, Loughs Agency, National Museums Northern Ireland, CEDaR, Queens University Belfast, Ulster University, Seasearch Northern Ireland, Ulster Wildlife, Coast Watch and amateur marine recorders.
     The complete database is submitted to JNCC biannually and merged into the Marine Recorder UK Snapshot for national reporting as well as monthly to the NBN Atlas (species point data only).

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Northern Ireland Marine Recorder Database - Collated Marine Species and Biotope Point Data

extras.value: ["Data marked as Public Access is freely available for research or commercial use providing that the originators are acknowledged in any publications produced. Where data is marked as Restricted the data provider must be contacted via CEDAR to request use of the data. If permission is granted, this may be at a reduced spatial resolution."]

["Data marked as Public Access is freely available for research or commercial use providing that the originators are acknowledged in any publications produced. Where data is marked as Restricted the data provider must be contacted via CEDAR to request use of the data. If permission is granted, this may be at a reduced spatial resolution."]
Centre for Environmental Data and Recording, Northern Ireland (originator, custodian)
